metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39417 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside a quoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator has installed files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, an attacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap superuser.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libecpg6 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpq5 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-client-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plperl-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-14 - 14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases.

criterions.comment: postgresql-14 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.9-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
